pages.text: This section will outline the blocks available to you to aid in item processing.

This block can store up to 10 recipes (with upgrades), which can all process recursively.$(p)Items can be placed into the crafting grid appropriately, where a ghost recipe will be filled. Once an appropriate recipe is entered, press the checkmark button to finalize it.

Items inputted are placed into the SIX gray processing slots. These slots can be modified. The slots circled in color are for intermediate crafting results.$(p)Every recipe can be set to either output to the RED output slot, or output to one or all of the colored intermediate slots below.$(p)Items in the intermediate slots can be removed but items cannot be put into them manually.

pages.title: Capacity Upgrade
pages.text: This upgrade will add additional recipe space as follows:$(li)1 Upgrade, Max 4 Recipes$(li)2 Upgrades, Max 6 Recipes$(li)3 Upgrades, Max 10 Recipes

pages.title: Sustained Upgrade
pages.text: This upgrade will allow the machine to run without power. Downside? No other upgrades can be installed. The machine will also be slower.

The Autocrafting Table can also support the general Speed Upgrade for the block!$(p)For recipes where the items are not used, such as Buckets in the Cake recipe, the empty container will be returned to the intermediate inventory.
This block, simply, can hold up to the 64-bit max value of a single item.$(p)$(7)$(o)That's 9.223 quintillion items!$(br)That's 9 trillion millions!$(br)Fill one of these, I dare you.
This block can be connected to a container. The Vacuum Hopper will pick up items in a 3x3 area in front of the block and place into the container.
